data.name: Casarecce Pasta With Broccoli and Tuna
data.description: This simple pasta with tuna and broccoli is the perfect weeknight meal.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Boil the broccoli in a large pot of unsalted water until just crisp-tender, around 3 minutes. Drain with a slotted spoon. Add salt to the water and add pasta to cook until al dente. 


In the meantime, chop thyme and wild fennel. Sauté broccoli and chopped shallot in oil. Add tuna, chili pepper, chopped thyme and fennel, salt and 2 ladles (around 1 cup) pasta cooking water. Cook for 10 minutes.

Drain the pasta when al dente and return to the warm pot. Stir in the sauce and sauté to coat. Serve immediately.

data.name: Ravioli with Rocket, Artichokes and Almonds
data.description: Topped with smokey artichokes, toasted almonds and herbs, this light ravioli recipe filled with ricotta and arugula is worth the effort.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
For the ravioli: Mix the flour with the egg, egg yolks and 2 Tbsp. water to obtain a smooth mixture (work it first in a bowl, then on a floured work surface). Cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 1 hour.
For the filling: wash and cut the arugula; chop the shallot and sweat it in a saucepan. To sweat the shallot, heat 1 1/4 oz. butter over medium-low heat. Add the shallot and stir frequently until soft (around 2 minutes) Add anchovy fillets, smashing them with a spoon to break them up, until they start to dissolve; finally add the arugula and salt, and cook for 5-6 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool. Mix with the ricotta and the pecorino. Scoop the filling into a pastry bag with a spoon or spatula.

For the ravioli: divide the dough into 4 pieces. Working with 1 piece at a time, keeping remaining dough wrapped in plastic as you work, flatten dough into a narrow rectangle. Roll out the dough lengthwise until the pasta sheet is 1/16" thick. Cut sheet of dough in half crosswise. Starting 1" from the short edge, spoon the filling in walnut-size mounds (1 Tbsp.), spacing about 1" apart; brush a little water around the filling and top with the second length of dough. Press around each mound of filling pressing outward toward the edges to remove any air pockets. Use a sharp knife or round or drop-shaped pastry cutter (2 1/4" diameter) to cut each ravioli. 

For the topping: trim the artichokes, removing the tough outer leaves and cut them into 8 wedges. Heat a thin layer of oil in a pan over medium-high heat and cook artichokes with a pinch of salt for 5 minutes. Add 1/2 cup wine and cook for 10 minutes.



Meanwhile, toast the almonds in a dry skillet. Add 1 Tbsp. butter and sauté them for 2 more minutes until they are glossy.

Bring water to a boil in a large pan and add salt. Add the ravioli and boil for 2-3 minutes or until they float to the surface, drain and dress with the butter and almonds. Top with artichokes and sage leaves and rosemary to taste. Serve immediately.

data.name: Mini Salmon Pandoro Club Sandwich
data.description: Cut the pandoro bread into horizontal slices, about 1/2 inch thick. Choose 3 slices from the middle, so that they are the most similar in size. Place ...
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Cut the pandoro bread into horizontal slices, about 1/2 inch thick. Choose 3 slices from the middle, so that they are the most similar in size. Place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper and toast at 340°F for 4-5 minutes. Mix the robiola cheese with a pinch of grated lemon zest and a few chives. Spread 2 of the 3 slices of bread with the cheese and top with the sliced salmon. Stack the slices and close the sandwich with the third, plain slice.

Cut it into 4 wedges and serve. Tip: With the rest of the pandoro, you can make other finger sandwiches, which can also be filled with robiola and salmon, or with other assorted ingredients. We chose to use robiola with the pandoro because the bread is already very rich in butter. Alternatively, you can make an herb butter: Whip 3-5 tablespoons of butter with a whisk to make it frothy, then mix it with chives and lemon zest. Then spread it on the pandoro and proceed as above.

data.name: Mini Pear Panettones with Mulled Wine Sauce
data.description: Peel and dice 1 pear; cook it in a pan for 4-5 minutes until dried out and golden. In a saucepan, combine the wine with 3 tablespoons of brown sugar, ...
data.author: Redazione Web

data.name: Bolognese-Style Soup
data.description: Mortadella and Parmigiano Reggiano, two key ingredients from the region of Emilia Romagna make this Bolognese-style soup, anything but ordinary.
data.author: Redazione Web
data.keywords: Piatti Della Tradizione,Piatti Della Tradizone,Piatti Regionali,Piatti Tipici,Piatto Regionale,Typical Dishes,Regione,Ricetta Regionale,Ricette Della Tradizione,Zuppa,Zuppe,Zuppe E Vellutate
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F. 

Finely chop the mortadella. In a mixing bowl, combine egg yolks, Parmigiano Reggiano, and 1/2 cup semolina. Add some grated nutmeg and a pinch of salt. Add 4 Tbsp. butter and mortadella. Beat egg whites to stiff peaks and add to the mixture.

Butter a wide, shallow rectangular pan with 2 Tbsp. butter. Dust with 1 tsp. semolina. Pour in the mixture spreading it out evenly and bake for around 20 minutes. Let cool and cut into cubes. 

Bring broth to a boil and cook the cubes for another 5 minutes. Serve.

data.name: Homemade Pasta With Ligurian Pesto
data.description: While using a mortar and pestle takes a bit of elbow grease, the resulting pesto can't be beat. Add homemade farfalle pasta, green beans and potatoes to the mix for this Ligurian classic dish.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
To prepare the pasta dough, place the flour in a mound on a flat surface, making a well in the middle. Add eggs and salt into the well. Using a fork, start carefully incorporating the flour from the walls of the well into the egg. When flour and egg are combined, knead dough with your hands until smooth and elastic. Cover the dough and let rest while you prepare the pesto. 


Finely chop half a peeled garlic clove and place it in a mortar. Wash basil and pat dry, then transfer 2 oz. to the mortar with the garlic, pine nuts, and a little coarse salt. Grind together to a chunky paste. Add 2 oz. Grana Padano cheese mixed with Pecorino Romano and 1/3-1/2 cup oil.

 Peel the potato and finely dice; chop green beans.

Roll out the pasta with a rolling pin, then use a wavy-edged roller to cut into rectangles. Pinch pasta rectangles in the center to create bow-shaped farfalle.

Bring a pot of water to the boil, add salt, and cook the green beans. After 3 minutes, add the pasta and potatoes and cook for 5-7 minutes. Remove using a skimmer and toss with the pesto to coat. Garnish with grated cheese and basil.

data.name: Tortiglioni With Anchovies
data.description: Addictively crunchy breadcrumbs and salt-packed anchovies are powerful flavor combination for this pantry pasta.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Remove the bones from the anchovies and rinse them thoroughly to remove the salt. 

Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. 

Heat the olive oil in a pan. Break the anchovies into pieces and add them to the pan with 2 peeled and slightly crushed garlic cloves. Add 6 Tbsp. bread crumbs and sauté. Add the finely chopped hazelnuts. Stir ensuring that the breadcrumbs and nuts brown and become crisp without burning.

Once the pasta is al dente, drain and toss in the pan to coat with the breadcrumbs. Remove the garlic, sprinkle with torn marjoram, and serve.

data.name: Penne With Mozzarella, Red Peppers and Capers
data.description: Smooth, tubular penne with mozzarella, red peppers and capers is an easy pasta for a weeknight dinner.
data.author: Redazione Web
ingredients: 1 roasted red bell pepper lobe, diced
instructions:
Cook penne in plenty of boiling salted water until al dente. 

In the meantime, slice spring onions thinly and sauté with oil and a spoonful of capers. Add diced bell pepper. Drain pasta when al dente and add to the pan. Toss quickly and add diced mozzarella. As soon as mozzarella begins to stretch and melt, remove from the heat. Sprinkle pasta with chopped parsley and serve immediately.

data.name: Farfalle With Almonds and Olive Tapenade
data.description: A quick summertime vegetarian pasta packed with in-season tomatoes, crunchy almonds, and briny olive tapenade.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Wash the tomatoes, cut them in half and toss them in a bowl with a drizzle of oil and the leaves of 4 sprigs of marjoram. 

Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until al dente.

Chop the almonds with a knife and sauté them in a pan with 1/4 cup oil for 1 minute.  Add the tomatoes and mix well. 

Drain the farfalle and top with the olive tapenade, tomatoes and almonds.

data.name: Anchovy Pie
data.description: Anchovy, acciuga, alice is a very versatile fish. Fresh anchovies baked with spinach, radicchio and ricotta make this anchovy pie a colorful and tasty main dish.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Place the flour in a bowl with the softened butter and a pinch of salt and knead it with your hands. Add 1/4 cup water and continue kneading to obtain a smooth and elastic shortcrust dough. Cover with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours to help it become more elastic and easier to roll out.

Clean the anchovies: remove the heads, slice them open like a book and remove the guts and scales, including the tail. 

Preheat the oven to 325°F.

Mix the egg yolks, cream, milk and mustard for a sauce.

Clean and coarsely chop the radicchio. Spoon the ricotta into the pan in large dollops, then add the radicchio, anchovies and spinach and sprinkle with the sauce. Bake in a convection oven for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve hot.

data.name: Mostaccioli Cookies from Molise
data.description: In a small saucepan, heat the honey with a dash of cinnamon and 1 clove ground to a powder, then add a little grated mandarin, orange or lemon zest. I...
data.author: Redazione Web
data.keywords: Cucina Regionale,Dolcetti,Dolcezze,Dolci,Dolci Di Natale,Natale,Natale 2018,Piatti Regionali,Piatti Regionalu,Piatto Regionale,Regione,Ricetta Regionale,Ricette Regionali
instructions:
In a small saucepan, heat the honey with a dash of cinnamon and 1 clove ground to a powder, then add a little grated mandarin, orange or lemon zest. In a blender or food processor, chop the almonds and hazelnuts to produce a coarse meal. Mix it with the flour, cocoa and sugar.

Then add the honey, spices, eggs, coffee, 2 tablespoons of oil, the cooked must and 1/2 packet (about 1 3/4 teaspoons) of baker’s ammonia or baking powder. Mix to form a dough and let it rest, covered, for 2 hours. Roll it out to 2 3/4 - 3 inches thick and cut it into diamond shapes, combining the scraps and rolling them out again until the dough is gone. Set the cookies on baking sheets covered with parchment paper, brush them with water and bake them at 340°F for 18-20 minutes.

For chocolate coating: In a double boiler, melt the chopped chocolate. Put the cookies, one at a time, on the tines of a fork and dip them into the melted chocolate, then let the excess drip off

and let them dry on a rack. To vary the coating, melt gianduja chocolate and mix in chopped hazelnuts.

data.name: Cassata
data.description: Cassata is a Sicilian cake made from sweetened ricotta, layered with slices of liqueur soaked sponge cake covered in green almond paste and decorated with candied fruit. To say it is decadent is an understatement.
data.author: Redazione Web
ingredients: candied fruit pieces (orange, citron and cherries)
instructions:
For the filling, mix the ricotta with 1 1/2 cups sugar, the seeds from half a vanilla bean pod, and a few drops of orange blossom water until creamy. Incorporate the chopped chocolate, 1/3 cup coarsely chopped pistachios, and the assorted candied fruit cubes. 

Line a cake pan with plastic wrap. Use a rolling pin, roll out the marzipan between two sheets of parchment paper dusted with powdered sugar until it is around 1/8" thick. Cut out strips as long as the cake pan is high. Use these strips to line the inside of the cake pan (you’ll have some scraps left over).

Cut the sponge cake into 1/2" thick slices and line the bottom of the cake pan with them. 

Bring 1/3 cup water to a boil with 1/4 cup sugar and, if desired, a lemon peel or a piece of a vanilla bean pod and 2 Tbsp. lemon liqueur. Let cool, then lightly brush the sponge cake with this mixture. Pour the filling into the cake pan, cover with other sponge cake slices. Press down gently, and brush with the liqueur mixture. Fold the plastic wrap over the cassata and chill in the fridge for 4-8 hours.

Melt the fondant sugar over low heat, then remove from the heat; stir continuously until you obtain a fluid mixture that drizzles off the spoon. Remove the cassata from the fridge; and turn it out onto a serving dish; pour the cooled fondant sugar on the center. Using a spatula, spread it evenly over the entire surface. Place it back in the fridge for another hour to set. Decorate the top with candied cherries, orange slices, and citron.

data.name: Polenta Crostini With Tuna
data.description: Crisp polenta is a tasty alternative to bread-based crostini. In this recipe, they are topped with burrata and smoked tuna for an extra bit of decadence.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Bring 4 cups salted water to a boil. Pour in the cornmeal with 1 Tbsp. oil; cook over low heat for 40 minutes, stirring often to prevent clumps.

Line a baking tray with parchment paper and pour the polenta onto it. Spread evenly to 1/2" thickness. Once hardened, cut into 18 pieces with a tear drop-shaped pasta cutter (2 1/4 x 1 1/2".).

Coat a pan with oil over medium-high heat. Pan fry the polenta for one minute per side. Remove the polenta crostini and spread the burrata cheese over them and top with tuna. Serve.

data.name: Spaghettoni Profumati (Fragrant Spaghetti)
data.description: A medley of Mediterranean herbs and lemon infuse spaghetti with bright flavors and aromas.
data.author: Redazione Web
ingredients: 2OZ. mixed herbs (thyme, wild fennel, rosemary, mint, parsley, marjoram)
instructions:
For the breadcrumbs: Chop the mixed herbs together. Heat the bread in a pan with a drizzle of oil and squeeze a bit of lemon juice on top. Remove the bread from the pan, season with about 1 oz. chopped herbs and 2 Tbsp. oil and blend everything together.

Bring a pot of water to a boil with a large pinch of salt, 2 bay leaves, and a pinch of chopped herbs. Cook the pasta in the fragrant water until al dente.

In the meantime, for the flavored oil: add the remaining chopped herbs and a squeeze of lemon juice to 1/2 cup oil.

Strain the pasta, reserving a bit of the pasta cooking water, and transfer back to the pot. Toss with the flavored oil, bread crumbs with herbs, Grana Padano cheese, and a bit of the cooking water. Cook for 30 seconds and serve.

data.name: Mandarin Olive Oil Cake
data.description: We love this simple citrus olive oil cake with decorative flutes and icing dripping down the sides.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F. Butter and flour Bundt pan; set aside. 

Grate 4 mandarins; juice 2 mandarins. Place the juice aside. Mix the zest with the yogurt. Combine the flour, cornstarch and baking powder in a large mixing bowl. Beat the eggs and the sugar until you have a pale, foamy mixture; gently add the oil first, then the yogurt, flour and a pinch of salt.

Butter a bundt cake pan (7 1/2" in diameter, 4 1/3" high), dust the bottom and sides with a little flour and pour in the batter and bake at for 40-45 minutes.

For the glaze: Dissolve the powdered sugar in 1 oz mandarin juice and whisk together for a couple of minutes.

Remove the cake from the oven and transfer it to a wire cooling rack. Let cool for 10 minutes and invert cake onto the rack. Let it cool completely, then trim the bottom with a knife to even it out. Drizzle with the mandarin glaze and decorate with slices of the remaining mandarins peele, kumquats and mint leaves.

data.name: Olive and Caper Bread
data.description: This Mediterranean bread with olives, sun-dried tomatoes, and capers makes for a deliciously impressive appetizer.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Dissolve the brewer’s yeast in 1 1/2 cups warm water. Pile the flour on a flat work surface. Add the dissolved yeast and salt and knead until uniform. Transfer to a bowl and cover with a damp kitchen towel. Set aside to rise for around 1 hour. 

Purée the black olives, Taggiasca olives, and sun-dried tomatoes with 1 Tbsp. oil and 2 Tbsp. water until creamy.

Line the bottom of a cake pan (diam. 10", h. 2 1/2") with a circle of parchment of paper. Using a rolling pin, roll out the dough to a thickness of around 1/8" in a square form. Trim the sides and spread the olive-tomato purée over the entire surface. Add the drained capers.

Cut the dough into 8 strips, 2 1/2" wide, the same as the height of the pan, and roll them into pinwheels. Arrange in the pan to form a flower: one pinwheel in the middle and the others around it, with a little space between them. Let rise, covered, for 1 hour.

Preheat the oven to 375 °F. Brush the top of the pinwheels with a little oil and bake for 45-50 minutes.

data.name: Cavatelli with Vedovo Sauce
data.description: Rough in texture and concave in shape, cavatelli 's hollow shell begs to be filled with sauce. In this recipe, Vedovo sauce - 'window's sauce'-  a combination of  oil, lard, parsley, fresh tomatoes, and basil make the perfect partner to coat each morsel.
data.author: Redazione Web
data.keywords: Cucina Regionale,Pasta,Piatti Regionali,Piatto Regionale,Primi,Primi Piatti,Primo,Regione,Ricetta Regionale,Ricette Regionali
instructions:
For the cavatelli, pile semolina on a flat work surface. Make a well in the center. Pour around 1 cup water and a pinch of salt into the well. Use a fork to gradually draw in the flour from the inside of the well continuing until the dough is compact. Continue to knead until it forms a smooth ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and let rest for 30 minutes. 



Flour the work surface well. Divide dough into 4 pieces; keep covered with plastic wrap. Roll one piece at a time into a long rope, around ¼”  in diameter, then cut rope into ¾” long pillows. Using tips of index and middle fingers, firmly press each piece against a gnocchi paddle or along a work surface so it lengthens slightly and forms a curl in the middle, the classic cavatello shape. Transfer pieces to baking sheets dusted with semolina flour. Repeat with remaining dough.



For the sauce: Blanch the tomatoes. To blanch the tomatoes, bring water to a boil. Add salt. Fill a large bowl with ice water. Add tomatoes to boiling water for 1 minute. Remove with a slotted spoon and plunge into ice water for 1 minute. Drain, peel, cut them into pieces and remove the seeds.

Chop the lard into ¼” cubes and work it with a knife to cream like consistency. Heat 2 Tbsp. oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat to fry the lard. Add 2 Tbsp. parsley and the garlic. Let cook for 2 minutes and add the tomatoes, a few basil leaves. Season with salt and pepper and cook for 25 minutes. 



In the meantime, bring a large pot of water to a boil and season with salt. Add the cavatelli and cook until the pasta floats to the surface (around 5-6 minutes). Drain and dress the cavatelli with the sauce. Garnish with a generous handful of pecorino and serve.

data.name: Pumpkin Risotto with Capers and Grapefruit
data.description: Remove the seeds from the pumpkin, then cut an opening on top of it (so steam can escape while cooking). Place it flesh side down on a baking sheet li...
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions: Remove the seeds from the pumpkin, then cut an opening on top of it (so steam can escape while cooking). Place it flesh side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake at 350°F for about 1 hour. When it's cooked, hollow out the pulp and blend it with a few tablespoons of water to obtain a fairly dense mixture. Fully peel the grapefruit and cut the rind into slices. Then boil the rind for 5-6 minutes and drain. Squeeze the grapefruit and boil the juice for 5 minutes. Then add in the boiled rinds and cook for 5 more minutes. Desalt the capers and coarsely chop them. Clean and chop half of the shallot. Heat the rice dry in a saucepan for 3 minutes with 4 pinches of salt. Add the chopped shallot and a splash of white wine. Let the wine evaporate, then gradually ladle in water as it continues cooking for 10 minutes. Then incorporate the pumpkin mixture and cook for 2-3 more minutes. Turn off the heat and stir in the butter and grated cheese. Plate the risotto, topping each with a spoonful of grapefruit and capers. As desired, garnish with caper leaves, fresh grapefruit slices, and ground pepper.

data.name: Orange Turkey with Spinach and Almonds
data.description: First squeeze the oranges. Coarsely chop the almonds. Sweat the spinach in a pan with a little oil for no more than 2-3 minutes. Keep warm....
data.author: Redazione Web

data.name: Spaghetti With Seafood Sauce and Crispy Thyme Bread Crumbs
data.description: Seafood sauce infused with lobster and scampi shells packs tons of flavor and lemony thyme bread crumbs add a nice crunch in this pasta recipe.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the lobster and parboil for 10-15 seconds after the water resumes boiling. Drain, and cool in ice water. Shell to remove the meat. Cut it into small chunks and set aside. Cut the head, the claws, and the carapace into pieces. Peel the scampi. Devein the tails and cut into chunks, then cut the heads and the claws into pieces.

Sauté the celery, onion, and carrot in a saucepan with 2 Tbsp. oil and 1 garlic clove for 5 minutes. Add the lobster and scampi heads and claws; turn up the heat and sauté for 3-4 minutes, crushing thoroughly to release the flavor. Continue cooking until the liquid evaporates.

Add 1 cup wine and let evaporate. Add the tomato paste and 1 1/2 qt. water. Decrease the heat and cook for another 45 minutes. Remove from the heat and purée in a blender until smooth. Pass through a conical sieve. 

Pulse the bread in a blender until fine. Sauté the breadcrumbs in a pan with 1 garlic clove and 1 Tbsp. oil, stirring constantly for 2 minutes until crisp and golden. Add the grated lemon zest, a pinch of salt and a few thyme leaves.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Trim the spring onions, score an x on the bottom of each, and parboil for 3 minutes. Drain, cool and cut in quarters lengthwise.

Transfer the seafood sauce to a large saucepan, season with a pinch of red pepper flakes (to taste) and cook to reduce for a few minutes.

Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Strain and add to the pan with the sauce. Add the lobster, scampi, and spring onions and stir to coat evenly. Distribute on plates and top with the crispy bread crumbs. Serve immediately.

data.name: Baked Gorgonzola Ravioli
data.description: Stuffed with mild gorgonzola, raisins, and lemon zest, crisp baked ravioli are a guaranteed hit.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
For the dough: Combine the flour, sugar, and chopped butter with a stand mixer or by hand. Add 1 egg, 2 yolks, the grated zest of half a lemon, and a pinch of salt. Continue mixing to obtain a smooth and even dough. Roll out the dough until it is about 3/4” thick (this will make it easier to roll out thinner later); transfer it to a tray, cover with plastic wrap, and chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.

For the filling: In a bowl, combine the crumbled gorgonzola, the raisins, 1 egg yolk, and the grated zest of half a lemon. 

Preheat the oven to 350°F. 

Separate the yolk and white of the remaining egg. Place 1 Tbsp. of filling in the center of each disc, then brush the edges with the egg white. Fold over into a half-moon shape to form the ravioli, pressing the edges to seal. Transfer the ravioli to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, brush with the egg yolk, and bake for 15 minutes at 350°F. Remove the ravioli from the oven and serve warm.

data.name: Pizzette della Nonna Rosita
data.description: Ready in 20 minutes, cheesy, saucy and crisp, one-bite pizzette (mini-pizzas) are the appetizer that everybody loves.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Cut the bread in half and place them on a baking sheet, crust side down. Cover the surface with the tomato sauce. Cut the mozzarella into small cubes and place 2 tsp. mozzarella  at the center or each pizzette (small pizza). Season with rosemary, salt and pepper. Bake for around 5 minutes or until the mozzarella starts to melt. Remove from oven, top each pizzetta with a little oil and serve immediately.

data.name: Carrot Salad with Fresh Cilantro
data.description: For the carrot salad with fresh cilantro recipe, clean the celery root and cut it into very thin sticks. Peel the carrots and slice them into strips....
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
For the carrot salad with fresh cilantro recipe, clean the celery root and cut it into very thin sticks. Peel the carrots and slice them into strips.

Heat 3 tablespoons of oil in a pan with 1 clove of crushed garlic with the peel; brown the carrots

and celery root for 3-4 minutes. Add salt, mix with the chopped escarole, season with a little oil

and finish with walnuts, grape slices and cilantro leaves.

data.name: Timbales With Sausage
data.description: If you remember the movie 'Big Night' you'll no doubt remember the elaborate pasta timballo filled with ground meat, tomato sauce, cheese and eggs. Timbales with sausage is a simpler version of this iconic dish baked in individual size molds.
data.author: Redazione Web
ingredients: 3 1/2OZ. mild Caciocavallo cheese, cut into 1/2" cubes
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 375°F. 

Remove the sausages from the casings and form into hazelnut size balls.

Sauté the garlic clove and a small bunch of basil, thyme and marjoram in a pan with a drizzle of oil. Add the tomatoes, season with a pinch of salt and cook for 10 minutes.

Blanch the fava beans. To blanch the fava beans, bring water to a boil. Add salt. Add fava beans to boiling water and let cook for 2 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and rinse with cold water. Peel off the skin. 


Boil the eggs in a saucepan for 10 minutes, then peel and chop. 

Remove the herbs and the garlic from the tomato sauce and strain to obtain a smooth sauce. 

Cook the anellini pasta in salted boiling water until al dente.

Grease 4 molds (5" diameter) with oil and sprinkle with bread crumbs (we use half-sphere molds). Distribute the pasta among them, covering the bottom and the sides. Place the meatballs in the center with the Caciocavallo cheese, fava beans, and eggs. Lastly, top with more pasta. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and let stand for 2-3 minutes before removing from the molds. Turn molds upside-down to remove the timbales and serve with fresh sprouts or sprigs of wild fennel to taste.

data.name: Simply Delicious Soup with Clam, Mushroom and Turnip Greens
data.description: Peel the turnip greens, keeping only the tenderest leaves and small flowers. Heat 1 clove of garlic and 1 sprig of thyme in a large pan with a veil of...
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Peel the turnip greens, keeping only the tenderest leaves and small flowers. Heat 1 clove of garlic and 1 sprig of thyme in a large pan with a veil of oil. Add the clams and cover with a lid to let them open. Remove the clams and filter the remaining cooking water, which you will use for the soup.

Clean the pan and heat some more oil to sauté 1 clove of garlic. Add the mushrooms and sauté for 1 minute. Then add the turnip greens and cannellini beans. Add some of the clam cooking water, followed by the vegetable stock and clams. Bring everything back to a boil and turn off the heat. Add salt and pepper to taste. Slice the baguette loaf and toast the slices in a pan with a drizzle of oil. Serve with the soup.

data.name: Ricotta Cheese Tortelloni With Butter and Sage
data.description: We never tire of classic butter and sage sauce; a recipe to have at the ready, it is quick and perfect to pour over ricotta and parsley stuffed tortelloni.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Combine the flour and 6 eggs. Knead until the dough (around 2 lbs.) is compact and smooth. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let the dough rest overnight.

For the filling: Chop a handful of parsley and mix it with the ricotta cheese, 1 Tbsp. of a beaten egg (to bind the ingredients), salt, 1 Tbsp. grated Parmigiano and plenty of nutmeg.

Roll out the dough until around 1/16" thick. Cut it into squares. Spoon an abundant tablespoon of the filling into the center of each square; fold over and press to seal form the tortelloni.

For the sauce, melt the butter in a small saucepan (1 1/2 Tbsp. butter per person) with the sage leaves. Pour over the tortelloni and serve with freshly grated Parmigiano cheese.

data.name: Cacio e Pepe Spaghetti With Mullet Roe
data.description: Literally "cheese and pepper", cacio e pepe is a Roman pasta of Pecorino Romano and cracked black pepper. This riff on a classic with bottarga (mullet roe) and lime is subtly salty with a mild fishiness of caviar.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Cook spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water. Set the timer for 2 minutes less than the cooking time recommended on the package. 


Cut the mullet roe into thin 1/8" slices and grate lime peel from one lime. Slice another lime into 1/4" rounds, then divide each slice into quarters. Place aside in separate bowls.  

In a bowl, melt the cheese with 2 ladles of the pasta cooking water (around 1 cup), mixing with a whisk.


In a large pan, melt 1 Tbsp. butter, add a generous amount of freshly ground pepper and 1/2 ladle pasta cooking water; drain the spaghetti and transfer it immediately to the pan. Cook for another 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove the pan from the heat, add the melted cheese and mix well. Distribute the spaghetti onto plates, garnish with the mullet roe slices, lime zest and a few lime slices. Serve immediately.

data.name: Polenta with Mushroom Ragù
data.description: FOR THE POLENTA: Bring 1 1/2 qt. water to a boil with 2 Tbsp. oil and a handful of salt, then add the flour and whisk, breaking up any clumps. Cook th...
data.author: Redazione Web
ingredients: 3/4LB. mixed minced meat (beef, pork, veal, prosciutto crudo)
instructions:
FOR THE POLENTA: Bring 1 1/2 qt. water to a boil with 2 Tbsp. oil and a handful of salt, then add the flour and whisk, breaking up any clumps. Cook the polenta over medium heat for 50 minutes, stirring frequently.

FOR THE MUSHROOM RAGÙ: Soak the dried mushrooms in a bowl of warm water for about 40 minutes, then remove. Set the water aside, squeeze the mushrooms dry, then chop them up. Dice the celery, carrots and onion, place in a pan. Stir-fry with a drizzle of oil and a cinnamon stick.

Cut the prosciutto crudo into 1” strips, add to the chopped vegetables along with the minced meat. Sautè for 5 minutes. Sprinkle 1 Tbsp. flour, adding mushroom water and ladlefuls of broth until creamy. Season with salt and pepper, and cook for 20 minutes. Transfer the polenta to a serving dish, pour the hot mushroom sauce on top and garnish with the parsley. If you like, take two fresh mushrooms, cut them into thick slices, brown them in butter and serve on top of the polenta.

data.name: Bucatini in Spicy Sauce
data.description: Spicy peperoncino (red chili pepper) adds the right amount of heat to this spicy summer pasta with eggplant and tomatoes.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Quarter the eggplant and fry in plenty of hot oil; add salt and set aside. 

For the tomato concassé: peel, seed, and roughly chop the tomatoes.

Cook the pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente and drain. 

Mince the anchovy fillets. Slice the onion and sauté in a large pan along with a drizzle of oil, the garlic cloves, the anchovy fillets, 1 whole chili pepper, and 1 Tbsp. capers. Add a small ladleful of pasta cooking water and let simmer. Season with salt and pepper. Add the tomato concassé and immediately after the bucatini, fried eggplant and torn basil. Quickly toss together and serve.

data.name: Chicken and Spinach Lasagna
data.description: Classic, homemade lasagna with a simple meat and tomato sauce layered with melty cheese and pasta is pure comfort food. This untraditional chicken and spinach lasagna with bechamel takes little effort to make and feeds a crowd.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Debone the chicken thighs, remove the skin, and cut the meat into small pieces. Place the bones in a saucepan with 2 qt. water, half of an onion, a few sprigs of parsley, 1 small carrot, and half of a celery stalk. Boil for 1 hour to obtain the chicken broth.

For the chicken ragù: Trim the rest of the celery and onion and dice both. Chop the leaves from one sprig of rosemary, one sprig of thyme, and one sprig of marjoram together. Place the chopped celery and onion in a saucepan with 1 1/2 Tbsp. oil. Add the chopped herbs and chicken pieces and sauté over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add 1 cup wine and let evaporate, then cover with 3/4 cup chicken broth. Cook for 30 minutes over low heat. Remove from heat and let cool.

For the béchamel: Heat the milk with a pinch of nutmeg and a pinch of salt. Place 2 Tbsp. butter and the flour in a small saucepan; heat and mix until an even roux forms, then add the hot milk-nutmeg mixture and cook until it starts to thicken. 

Spread 1 Tbsp. of the béchamel on the bottom of an oven-safe baking dish (7” x 7” and 1 1/2” deep). Add a layer of pasta sheets and cover with 2-3 Tbsp. ragù; sprinkle with the Castelmagno cheese. Repeat these steps until the dish is full. Bake the lasagna at 320°F for 20 minutes, then raise the temperature to 400°F and cook for another 8-10 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve immediately.

Sauté the spinach in a pan with 2 Tbsp. butter and a pinch of salt for 2-3 minutes. Add this to the chicken ragù and mix well.

data.name: Ginger Risotto with Herb Oil
data.description: Risotto like pasta is the foundation of many dishes. This take on risotto with ginger and grapefruit zing is refreshingly delicious.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
In a blender or food processor, blend the parsley and dill with the sunflower and olive oil to obtain a smooth sauce. 

Transfer it to a small saucepan, heat it for a few minutes over low heat, then filter it through a fine mesh sieve to create an aromatic oil.

Peel the ginger and finely mince it. Boil the vinegar and sugar to create a syrup, then cook the ginger in it for 5-6 minutes.

In a saucepan, heat 2-3 cups broth over low heat. In another pan, melt a pat of butter with a pinch of salt and toast the rice for 1 minute. Add 1/2 cup wine and let evaporate. Add the broth, covering the rice, and bring to a simmer. Add hot broth in 1/2 cup increments as the broth is absorbed and cook to al dente. Season with salt to taste.

Remove risotto from the heat, add 1 Tbsp. butter, 2 Tbsp. grated cheese, the herb oil, and 1/2 tsp. ginger syrup. Plate the risotto and top with chopped ginger and grated grapefruit zest.

data.name: Fusilli With Chili Pepper, Ricotta, and Anchovies
data.description: A bright summertime pasta with red chili pepper infused oil, anchovies and ricotta that comes together in around 15 minutes.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Cook fusilli in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. 

Mix ricotta with 3 Tbsp. olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

Sauté 2 unpeeled, slightly crushed garlic cloves in 3 Tbsp. olive oil for 1 minute. Slice 1 red chili pepper in half and add it to the pan along with chopped anchovies, and a pinch of oregano. After 2-3 minutes, add 1 Tbsp. water, then turn off the heat. Let cool and remove garlic and chili pepper.

Strain the fusilli. Pour flavored oil over the pasta and top with cold ricotta. Serve immediately.

data.name: Kale chips with sesame seeds and goat cheese
data.description: Easy to make crispy, crunchy kale chips topped with sesame seeds and goat cheese satisfy any craving.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Clean the kale leaves, dry and pat them well. Toss them with a little oil and salt. Place them in the microwave on fry mode for 1 minute and 30 seconds or arrange on a microwave-safe plate between two sheets of microwave safe parchment paper at 600W for 1 minute and then on high for another 30 seconds. Check for crispness. 



Mix the goat cheese with a little oil and the lemon zest. Serve the chips sprinkled with sesame seeds, dollops of goat cheese and a little coarsely ground pink pepper.

data.name: Sea Bass Tortelli in Fish Broth
data.description: Sea bass tortelli are the perfect addition to any fish based menu; buttery, delicate, and light.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Cut the carrot, celery and onion into small pieces. Fillet the sea bass and skin the fillets. Eliminate the head; rinse the other scraps and put them in a large pot with the carrot, celery and onion. Cover with water and add 1 bunch of dill and 1 bunch of parsley, plus a pinch of salt. Place over medium heat and cook until the water begins to steam.

Cook the broth without ever bringing it to a boil for around 30 minutes. 

Mix the flour with the eggs and a pinch of salt. Work the mixture until it becomes smooth and elastic. Let it rest covered with plastic wrap for around 30 minutes.

Remove the bones from the sea bass fillets with fish bone tweezers and cut the fillets into small pieces. Blend with the cream, egg white, a sprig of dill, salt, pepper, the lemon zest and orange zest, for the filling.

Roll out the dough into a very thin sheet. Place the filling in a pastry bag and distribute it on the dough in small, well-spaced walnut-sized balls. Cut squares of dough with a fluted pastry cutter (~2" side). Close them in a triangle over the filling, then join the two tips to close the tortelli (around sixty in total).

Strain the fish broth and put it back in the saucepan; bring it nearly to a boil and add a pinch of salt. Add the tortelli and cook for 2-3 minutes, still without boiling. Serve with the broth, garnished with fresh sprigs of dill.

data.name: Focaccia
data.description: To make focaccia, first gently combine the flour with the semolina. Dissolve the yeast in 3/4 cup water at room temperature. Combine the flour with 2 ...
data.author: Redazione Web
data.keywords: Cucina Regionale,Focacce,Focaccia,Piatti Regionali,Piatti Regionalu,Piatto Regionale,Regione,Ricetta Regionale,Ricette Regionali
instructions:
To make focaccia, first gently combine the flour with the semolina. Dissolve the yeast in 3/4 cup water at room temperature. Combine the flour with 2 tsp sugar, then begin kneading together, adding the yeast and water mixture a little at a time; next, add the milk, 1/4 cup oil, and finally 2 tsp fine salt.

Form into a ball, then transfer to a bowl, cover with a moist towel, and set aside to rise for at least 1 hour. 

Grease a rectangular baking tray with an oil and water emulsion. Stretch out the dough over the tray, press down with your fingers to form small indentations, then grease the surface with more oil and water emulsion. Cover with a moist towel and set aside for 30 minutes to rise.

Sprinkle with coarse salt, brush with more emulsion if necessary, then bake for 20-25 minutes at 320°F.

Remove from the oven and from the mold, then cut into portions before serving.

data.name: Macaroni Risotto With Carrots and Blueberries
data.description: Risotto-style pasta is the secret to this creamy macaroni risotto. Pasta starch is released into the stock, while the carrots and pasta cook until al dente. A handful of blueberries and toasted seeds top it off for a complete dinner.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Heat the macaroni in a saucepan with 1 Tbsp. oil for a couple of minutes, then add 2 ladles (around 1 cup) broth, stir and continue cooking for 1 minute. Add the carrots and continue to cook for around 10 minutes, adding a ladleful of broth whenever the cooking liquid evaporates; season with salt if necessary.

In a hot pan with a drizzle of oil, toast the seeds and walnuts for 2-3 minutes. 

Divide the pasta "risotto" between the dishes, garnish with the toasted seeds and a handful of blueberries, and serve.

data.name: Caciocavallo Cheese Bites
data.description: Melted Caciocavallo cheese, breaded and stuffed with sautéed chicory is the definition of indulgence.
data.author: Redazione Web
ingredients: 1 garlic clove, crushed with skin on
instructions:
Wash and shred the chicory; blanch the chicory. To blanch the chicory, bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add salt. Fill a large bowl with ice water. Add chicory to boiling water for 1 minute. Remove with a slotted spoon and plunge into ice water for 1 minute. Drain and squeeze gently to remove excess water. 



 

Chop the chili pepper in ⅛” pieces. Heat 3-4 Tbsp. oil in a pan with the garlic, a few pieces of chili pepper and the chicory over low heat and cook for 5 minutes. Remove the garlic and roughly chop the chicory. 



Preheat the oven to  400°F.

Divide the chicory in 4 equal parts and spoon over 4 slices caciocavallo. Close like a sandwich with the 4 remaining slices, pressing down slightly so that they stick together.



Beat the egg in a shallow bowl. Place flour in another shallow bowl and breadcrumbs in a third bowl. Place flour in another shallow bowl and eggs in a third shallow bowl. Working one at a time, dip the caciocavallo 'sandwiches' in the flour, then in the egg, allowing excess to drip off. Coat in breadcrumbs. 



Bake for 15 minutes.

data.name: Turkey Braised in Apple Juice
data.description: Fry the turkey in a hot saucepan without any added fats with the skin side down for 2-3 minutes, then turn it over and fry the other side for 1 minute...
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Fry the turkey in a hot saucepan without any added fats with the skin side down for 2-3 minutes, then turn it over and fry the other side for 1 minute. Baste it with the apple juice, add salt to taste and a couple of sprigs of rosemary and continue cooking, covered, for 25 minutes. Remove the cover and cook gently for another 30 minutes, turning occasionally.

For the green onions and apples: Cut off the ends of the green onions and cut them in half lengthwise without peeling them. Heat a pan with a drizzle of oil and a sprig of rosemary and cook the green onions in it for 3 minutes with the cut side down. Turn them over and continue cooking for another 3-4 minutes. Cut the apples into 8 wedges and remove the cores. Fry them in a pan with a pat of butter for 1-2 minutes per side, until they start to turn golden. Remove from heat and add salt to taste. Serve the braised turkey with the apples and green onions.

data.name: Beef and Sausage Meatballs
data.description: These rustic meatballs made with ground beef and sausage are Italian comfort food at its best.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Chop rosemary leaves and set aside. 



Remove the sausage from its casing. In a large mixing bowl, use your hands to combine the ground beef and sausage. Add the egg, rosemary, Parmigiano Reggiano, a pinch of salt and pepper. Mix thoroughly until smooth. 



Form about 1” diameter firm and compact meatballs by moving the mixture from palm to palm. 



Place flour in a dish and dredge meatballs through it. Shake off excess flour. 



Heat 4-5 Tbsp. oil in a 12” skillet over medium-high heat. Add the meatballs a few at a time being careful not to overcrowd the pan. Brown on each side. 



Add white wine and continue to cook for 5-8 minutes - the center of the meatballs should be pink, then serve.

data.name: Cake with Oil, Lentils and Nuts
data.description: Soak the lentils for 2 hours, then rinse, drain and boil them for 35-40 minutes in 1 2/3 cup water with 2 1/2 tablespoons granulated sugar and half a ...
data.author: Redazione Web
ingredients: 50G olio di arachide più un po’

data.name: Fried Pipe Pasta Cubes
data.description: For the fried pipe pasta cubes recipe, melt the butter, remove it from the heat and carefully combine with the flour. Add a pinch of nutmeg and salt. ...
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
For the fried pipe pasta cubes recipe, melt the butter, remove it from the heat and carefully combine with the flour. Add a pinch of nutmeg and salt. Combine the mixture with the nearly boiling milk and cook for a couple of minutes, stirring with a whisk to obtain a smooth bechamel. Remove the bechamel from the heat and melt in the fontina cheese cut into cubes, and the Grana Padano cheese.

FOR THE PASTA: Boil the water for the pasta, season with salt, and cook the pipe. Drain once they are al dente and toss in the fontina cheese sauce. Arrange them in a baking dish lined with parchment paper; level them and compact them by pressing them with the bottom of another pan. Let chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour. Cut the pasta horizontally obtaining two layers; cover one with thin slices of provola cheese, overlap with the other layer and cut the pasta into about 2 1/2 inch cubes.

Dip the pasta cubes in the beaten eggs and coat with breadcrumbs. Immediately fry them in abundant hot peanut oil. Drain when golden and serve hot. To finish with a very American touch, serve with 1 1/3 tbsp of mayonnaise mixed with 1 tbsp of mustard and finely chopped chives.

data.name: Caramelle with Mortadella and Pumpkin Velouté
data.description: Caramelle pasta stuffed with mortadella, Grana Padano, and amaretti, served over velvety winter squash purée is a spin on Tortelli di Zucca (pumpkin ravioli) from Emilia-Romagna. The artfully twisted parcels burst with flavor.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F.



For the pumpkin velouté 

Clean the pumpkin, removing the seeds and leaving the skin.  Cut it into slices and season with salt, a drizzle of oil and bake for 50 minutes. 



Meanwhile, heat the broth in a saucepan over low heat.



Remove the pumpkin from the oven and remove the pulp. Purée with 2 ladles of warm broth, a few rosemary leaves, 2 Tbsp. oil, a pinch of salt and freshly ground pepper. 



For the filling 

Blend the mortadella with 1 egg, the Grana Padano and the amaretti. 



For the caramelle (candy shaped stuffed pasta)

Mix the flour with 1 egg, 1/2 Tbsp. oil and 4 Tbsp. water, working the ingredients until you have a smooth and soft mixture. Flour a work surface and roll out the dough into a ⅛” thick sheet. Cut out circles (2 ¼” diameter).  Placing a walnut-size ball of the filling in the center of each circle; fold over into half moons. Flatten the dough around the filling to remove the air. Press the ends of the crescent between your fingers and press the filing with your thumb to give the shape of a piece of candy twisting the ends like a candy wrapper. 



Melt 2 Tbsp. butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat.



Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add salt. Add the caramelle to the boiling water and cook for 3 minutes or until they float to the surface. Drain with a slotted spoon and toss in the melted butter.



Pour the pumpkin velouté into shallow bowls and distribute the caramelle on top. Garnish with rosemary sprigs and serve immediately.

data.name: Pasta with Squash, Sausage and Lettuce Cream
data.description: Sweet squash, hearty sausage and fresh mint make for the perfect winter pasta dish.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Clean and boil the lettuce leaves, drain, squeeze and purée with the ricotta and a pinch of salt to obtain a smooth cream.

For the pasta: Chop the onion. Remove the sausage from the casing and cut into 1/2" pieces. Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in a large pan over medium heat, add the onion and brown for 5 minutes. Then add the sausage; cook it by crushing and crumbling it for a couple of minutes. Add a splash of wine and cook for another 8-10 minutes. 

Dice the pumpkin in 1/4" cubes. Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in another pan and cook the pumpkin for around 5 minutes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add salt. Add the pasta, cook to al dente, drain it reserving 1 cup pasta cooking water. Spoon the pasta directly into the pan with the sausage; add the pumpkin and stir, adding, if needed, a little cooking water. Top with the cream and mint leaves to taste.

data.name: Sweet Penne and Almond Milk Soup
data.description: Sweet pasta is not new to Italy. In fact, during the Renaissance, when pasta was a luxury good, it was paired with other luxury items like cinnamon and sugar. This sweet penne and almond milk soup with oranges and pistachio nuts is a surprising treat.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Bring 8 1/2 cups water to a boil in a saucepan with 3/4 cup granulated sugar and a pinch of salt. Add pasta and cook it for the time indicated on the package and drain. Melt butter in a pan with powdered sugar. Add pasta and stir, allowing the flavor to meld, for 30 seconds. 

Heat almond milk in a pan and dissolve cornstarch and 1/4 tsp. vanilla in it. Cook for 3-4 minutes, until it thickens a little bit. 

Grate orange zest, then peel the orange, remove the pith and chop the flesh into cubes. Cut candied orange peel into small pieces.

Dissolve remaining granulated sugar in a pan with 2 Tbsp. water; when it starts to change color, add a handful of pistachios and mix for 30-40 seconds.

Divide almond milk between the dishes, and then mezze penne pasta. Garnish with orange cubes, candied peel and pistachios.Top with the grated zest and, if you like, with fennel fronds and small meringues.

data.name: Bread and chicory
data.description: Bruschetta with sautéed chicory, garlic, peperoncino, and olive oil is a Roman staple. In our version, we switch out bread for croutons and add egg yolks for protein for a complete meal.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Cook the eggs in the roner at 140°F for 1 hour and 30 minutes. Shell the eggs, separate the yolks from the whites, and beat the yolks in a small bowl with a drop of water. Set aside. 

In the meantime, preheat the oven to 340°F and bring water to a boil in a large pot, season with salt and add 1 tsp. vinegar.


Peel the potatoes and cook in the boiling water (the optimal cooking point for this recipe is when the core temperature is 190°F). Drain them, cut them into slices, then into 1/2" cubes. 

Cut the bread into 1/2" cubes and toast it in the oven for 4-5 minutes to make croutons. 


Heat a little oil in a saucepan and add the anchovy fillets and let them melt. Add 2 Tbsp. white wine, the chicory, and a dash of water. Cook for another 2 minutes. Add the potatoes and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from the heat, let rest for 5 minutes, then add the beaten egg yolks, a dash of water and chili pepper, and top with croutons and serve.

data.name: Spaghetti all'Arrabbiata (Spicy Spaghetti)
data.description: A Roman classic dish, spaghetti all'arrabbiata is enjoyed throughout Italy. Arrabbiata literally means 'angry' in Italian, referring to the sauce made with tomatoes and hot red chili peppers that packs a spicy kick.
data.author: Redazione Web
instructions:
Bring water to a boil in a 6 qt. pot. Season with salt. Add the spaghetti. 

Meanwhile, heat 3 Tbsp. olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, a whole chili pepper, a dozen olives, and 1 Tbsp. capers and sauté 3 minutes.

Add the tomatoes and cook for around 5 minutes until the sauce thickens.

Drain the spaghetti when cooked to al dente and toss quickly in the saucepan. Transfer to a bowl and serve garnished with fresh basil.

data.name: Artusi’s Italian Trifle
data.description: Discover how to create this delicious Italian trifle inspired by Pellegrino Artusi, author of the first extensive Italian cookbook
data.author: Redazione Web

data.name: Pumpkin Ravioli
data.description: Make a dough with the flour, 2 eggs, and a tablespoon of oil and knead until well mixed. Let the dough rest, unrefrigerated, in a bowl covered with pl...
data.author: Redazione Web
ingredients: 2/3C. grated Grana Padano cheese, plus a bit more
instructions:
Make a dough with the flour, 2 eggs, and a tablespoon of oil and knead until well mixed. Let the dough rest, unrefrigerated, in a bowl covered with plastic wrap for 2 hours. Clean the pumpkin and remove the seeds, but leave the skin on. Cut it into slices. Place the pumpkin in a baking pan lined with parchment paper, cover it with aluminum foil and bake it at 350°F for 1 hour, until very soft.

Crush the amaretto cookies, chop up the mostarda, and beat 1 egg. Separate the pumpkin flesh from the skin and add the crumbled cookies, the mostarda with 2 tablespoons of its liquid, the cheese, a pinch of salt, some freshly ground pepper, and mix until smooth and uniform. Roll the dough into a long sheet 1 mm thick and divide it in half.

Brush one of the sheets with the beaten egg and place down a tablespoon of filling in dollops about 1 inch apart, then cover with the other sheet of dough. Press the dough together between the dollops of filling and cut the ravioli with a pasta cutter or ravioli tablet.

Drop the ravioli into salted boiling water and cook them for about 3 minutes until they float to the top. Melt 2 pats of butter in a small pan, remove the ravioli with a slotted spoon, distribute them on the plates and top with the melted butter and plenty of grated cheese.
